stepAnswer: The AROC is the average rate of change on the interval [x,x+h] and the derivative is the instantaneous rate of change at x.
stepTitle: What is the difference between the average rate of change of a function on the interval $$[x,x+h]$$ and the derivative of the function at $$x$$?
answerLatex: The AROC is the average rate of change on the interval $$[x,x+h]$$ and the derivative is the instantaneous rate of change at $$x$$.
